author: Gingerpig
title: My visit to the Orthopedic departmen
body: I have been under the care of Mr Qadir for over 8 years. He did my left knee replacement in February 2013 and I have had follow up appointments since then. He (and his staff) are always very professional and treat me as a person. During Covid I had telephone appointments with him and as my right knee is now painful he made me a face to face appointment to ascertain whether I need it replacing, which he thinks I do. Also my left kneecap is arthritic so he is keeping his eye on that too. I am seeing him again in 6 months with up to date xrays.

author: Bebelalaluluspain
title: Amazing doctor
body:
They were 3 doctors when I arrived to get my brakes on my knee today after I fractured the Patella bone and twisted tendons.  
One particularly, blondie with blue eyes and tattoos on his arm, he was AMAZING.  
He kept the good humour with me, and we laugh very much about my own situation, making it feel a positive experience rather than so bad.  
Thank you SO much for such a good attention, whomever you are!  
It made the difference and made my day better.  
X

author: Dicksoh
title: Amazing job with Covid vaccination
body:
I had my 2nd covid vaccination today and I can't thank the team enough.  
The clinical staff and volunteers are doing an amazing job delivering this life changing programme and I want to thank every single one of them. Keep up the fantastic work!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: jackpottx95
title: Liver damage
body: Having been given 3 months to live 18 months ago Aisling became my liver nurse, I give her 90% credit for my near full recovery ( of course my liver will never be perfect ) She talks to me like a friend, never judgemental and always positive, following her advice has saved my life for sure, Thank you Aisling you are an asset to the RAH. - yours thankfully : )

author: chritine
title: hospital care
body:
my husband was admitted over a week ago  
didn't know what they were treating took him 3 hours for a drink  
called his wife asking for help which was upsetting as he is diabetic and needs care i am devastated and am crying all the time

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Mordena21
title: Lack of treatment
body:
Without my consent I was allocated a locum GP who had not practiced for some years. Now for 5 months this doctor has failed to do my referrals to specialists delaying my treatment by 5 months. They have constantly said they have done the referrals but the referrals team confirmed that this doctor did not do them.  
Also for 5 months although I have a repeat prescription, the locum GP has constantly made errors with my medication under prescribing and leaving out life saving medication and all pain killers yet my surgery has been delayed due to covid. My monthly repeat prescription is very straight forward every month this person makes errors.  
To make it worse a clerk who works for the council primary care contracts called the pharmacy who wanted to order my repeat medication and told the pharmacist off and stopped them from ordering my medication and my medication is now 18 days late.  
The locum made errors again. The locum has been contacted by the pharmacy and me for 18 days and is refusing to do the extremely late prescriptions and extremely late referrals. This is delaying my treatment and certainly endangering my life. I feel I am being subjected to health inequality.

title: Changing my Mindset
body: I have been attending this surgery since I moved to Middlesbrough in 2016. Like many NHS Services it does seem that the team are working to capacity and like the rest of the surgeries Iâ€™ve ever attended, you do have the annoying â€˜50 phone calls laterâ€™ to get through on a morning to book an appointment... BUT... And hereâ€™s the important part... All of the doctors, nurses and healthcare professionals at Newlands Medical Centre have a genuine level of care for their patients; I have found them incredibly approachable, diligent and many even go above and beyond to support. The team at Newlands Medical Centre have supported me to realise that having multiple and complex healthcare needs isnâ€™t me being a burden; that actually there are things I can do to better my health and well-being and that no question is a silly question. The team work incredibly hard and it saddens me to see that they only have 2 stars. I very rarely would give 5 stars on a review because Iâ€™m of the school of thought that we can all do better, but the way the surgery has continued to support patients over the past year has been exemplary! I never used to like going to the doctors as a child but now not only do I not mind it - I often enjoy it because I know Iâ€™m in good hands.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Disallusioned
title: Staff had wrong information about my operation
body:
I fractured my hip through falling on New Eve and was taken to Pilgrim Hospital Boston. The ambulance staff were very kind and supportive, the wait to get into A and E was not excessive and the care was good.  
I was transferred to Orthopaedic Ward, I was operated on in early January due to lists being full and had spinal block. All appeared ok, was told before op it was to be a complete hip replacement. On my return the ward said it was partial, and I was treated as such, no support stocking, turned regularly.  
I was kept in bed until Thursday then was helped to edge of bed and was violently sick, given blood transfusion, stayed in bed until Friday. I started walking on Saturday, on Sunday and Monday was given exercises, and home on Monday evening.  
On retuning to see the consultant in March he confirmed it was complete and bone had had to be wired. Until then I was not aware and was not given appropriate information on care and support of a full hip replacement, only been told by ward to get on with life and nothing else.  
I was told physio would follow but nothing was organised and when I enquired at Pilgrim on physio number was told no physios, and if I was in pain to go to A and E, and ring ambulance if necessary. Not ideal in pandemic or other times, really.  
I have felt let down, am aware of constraints of pandemic. I feel I should have been out of bed sooner to aid my muscles and more consideration should have been given. I do realise that if staff were given wrong information about my case it was difficult.

author: Mrsmoore
title: Covid testing
body:
Had a covid test done prior to a procedure.  
Staff were very informative and extremely friendly put me at ease right away. Lovely, clean and tidy.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: corvusnz35
title: Unfriendly experience of Frimley Park EPU
body:
I began to bleed and loose blood at 8 weeks. I called the community midwife team and they said to wait and see if it stopped. So I waited and it didnâ€™t.  
I was then referred for a early scan a further day later. I arrived for the scan. It was awful. I was given a form to complete by a very unfriendly receptionist and told to take a seat in the corridor where social distancing is impossible as the corridor is a meter wide and everyone has to walk through it to get to main building. There is no privacy, no air flow and no human kindness.  
I waited over an hour for a scan to see if my baby was alive after 3 days of panic and upset at home. I then waited in a hot unventilated corridor for an unsympathetic, unapologetic team to offer me reassurance that never came.  
I have 3 children and this was without a doubt the worst care I have received in hospital and during a pandemic I would expect more in terms of safety, privacy and dignity.

title: Unprofessional staff
body: Receptionist turned us away saying we got no appointment booked for blood test then another lady phoned us by 4pm saying she was waiting for us since 2o clock.

author: starbw75
title: Well organised Covid vaccination
body: Attended clinic for Covid vaccine. Excellent organisation and all infection control procedures strictly adhered to.

title: Audiology--The Hearing Centre-- Professional staff
body:
Following my referral to the Audiology Department (CUH) by my GP, I received a phone call from an Audiologist who asked me very relevant questions and advised me what to do,and told me that he will send me some information by post.  I received the leaflet which was very useful. I also received the Appointment letter from the Hearing Centre for initial assessment.
On the due date I was assessed, discussed and given relevant information by the specialist audiologist. I was advised that I shall hear from the E N T in due course.
Whilst I wait to hear from E N T, I would like to express my gratitude and sincere thanks to staff at the Hearing Centre for their professionalism and care I received from them.

title: Don't think you know better ...
body: I was reluctant to attend my colonoscopy today because although I had a positive (not right) result from my NHS stool sample test I had a negative from the test I bought online albeit with fantastic reviews.  Being someone who totally believes in taking up any tests, jabs, etc. offered by the NHS I felt compelled to attend.  I'm so glad I did now because the test showed 4 polyps of varying size which were biopsied and I'll get the results in a couple of weeks. Everyone was so kind, friendly, sympathetic and utterly professional.  I don't honestly think private care could be any better and I would recommend everyone to take their test and follow the advice of the team because they really do have our best interests at heart and leaving it could result in something none of us is ready for!! :)

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Dreadful
body:
Experiencing flare of serious condition following vaccine.
Failure to request all blood tests needed.
Wasted time doing extra tests delays specialist referrral. 
Problems accessing results online/via practice due to appointment system (despite receiving texts to call the practice) 
Lack of appointments on the day.

title: Cancelled appointment. Poor Communication
body:
Attended Lister today for an Endocrinology out-patient appointment - only to be told it had been cancelled. Also told that a cancellation letter had been posted on 31st December but I can say categorically that this was not received. After a 25 minute telephone call I managed to book a new appointment in six weeks time. 
I do understand that the NHS has been more than busy but the lack of communication has left me more than disappointed. Over many years my condition has never quite reached the top of the in tray and this further delay is just one more straw on the camel's back.

title: Lovely people
body: I was taken to hospital via ambulance and was taken great care of from everyone from call then ambulance then the staff at hospital. I had sudden excruciating pain in my lower back and had felt so silly for being there but the staff were so kind and understanding and for also getting me pain relief so quickly. I just wanted to say a big thank you to everyone involved. Keep up the awesome work. Kind regards Mrs Carrick

title: Great visit today
body:
Today I visited the surgery and saw a lovely nurse, she was excellent. 
I was not rushed and she explained everything to me.
I would like to say all the staff I have come into contact with are great.
There is a problem with the phone system, trying to get through is a nightmare. This really let's the surgery down, I think the staff when you get through are all kind and caring.
However I think most surgeries seem to have the same problem,  too many patients perhaps.

title: extremley disappointed
body:
Since amalgamated the three surgeries, the care of the patience has dropped from first class to very poor. for example my wife returned from Q.A.H after having a procedure with the instructions to have the wound checked and re-dressed by our surgery. In order to do this I spent 20 mins on the phone to get a nurse appointment. I was told that there were no appointments available for a week. I was then directed to another practice.
 Under the old system appointments were held back for emergencies. This is just the latest of a long list of unsatisfactory experiences.
When it was the highlands practice we were proud to be registered there and used to tell others of our good experiences.
However after over thirty years with this practice wil feel it has almost hit its lowest ever level.

title: Over and beyond
body:
I would like to say what an amazing team you have at teenage cancer trust YPU ward, 
We stayed for 5 nights in Bed 22 ,  

The care was so lovely and personal to us. 

The whole team made us feel special. 

You make such a difference at a time when things were so challenging. 

Each staff member was amazing. 
Nothing was ever too much trouble. 
We were discharged yesterday and you made the whole process smooth explaining
things to us and putting our mind at rest. 
You cared for my brother who was your patient and I was accompanying him. 
I have not stopped saying to all our family how brilliant everyone was. 
Thank you all and keep doing  what you do. 
A huge gratitude for all you do ðŸ˜€
You are the super heroes of the NHS.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Telephone Service
body: I phoned the new number this morning (14th April) to arrange a blood test. The queue was 43 calls long. I tried again later and it was up to 47 calls. I decided to leave calling until the evening when, hopefully, it would be quieter. I phoned at 18.25 and was placed at position 12 in the queue. I moved to position 1 at 21.02.  I appreciate there are difficulties with the new system but a temporary change to the welcome message giving guidance would have helped. A very stressful and time wasting experience. I came out of the queue at 23.05.

title: Excellent.
body:
Staff were incredibly friendly; nurse who saw me was lovely. In and out through a very streamlined system; social distancing and hygiene protocols to a T. 

Vaccination itself took what felt like a second - in, plunge, out, cotton; very slick! 

Back home and my deltoid is sore so it must be doing its job. 

Really a fantastic, well co-ordinated unit - staff look to be working tirelessly to keep everything clean. Can't praise them enough.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank You Outstanding Practice
body:
I used  the online website system and within a few hours my query had been dealt with. I had a call from a very helpful and understanding doctor who took their time to understand and went out of their way to explain things and to offer additional help. My prescription was ready for me to collect  directly from my local pharmacy which was much appreciated.
I have needed to use this Practice many times and I must say they have always been very helpful and understanding and seem to work so hard to help.  It must be a tough job sometimes as i have heard on occasions how demanding and rude people can be. I have never had a problem with the reception staff. I did have a period of needing to see the nurse and again she was very helpful and pleasant and took her time to explain things and followed up on booking me additional appointments which again was much appreciated. Well done to the whole team and the efforts you have all made for many years and particularly over the last year. Simply an outstanding GP Practice.

author: christofer
title: Boy, 8 years old, with shortness of breath
body:
On 111 advice i took my son to a&e so he could be seen by a professional as he complained of shortness of breath.After few hours waiting , which we were prepared for that, but my son felt so unwell , a doctor checked his chest said he was fine  
but also sent us for a x-ray to check his lungs.everything looked perfect and i appreciate the correct way of checking my son. finally x-ray result came and the doctor explained that he could  
see a shadow on his left lung so it looked  
like a viral  
infection that probably was ongoing for  
a while.my son didnt have any other symptoms such as  
temperature or cough just this breathing issue.so we left hospital with a course of 7 days of antibiotics. all fine , really pleased with the care for my son. second day his breathing hasnâ€™t improved and  
got worst and the child became  
a bit anxious as he could  
not understand what was wrong with  
him  
and why he could not breathe properly and had that pressure on his chest. next night we called the ambulance, all our respect for  
them, they explained whats going on and why his situation didnt improve , as with the antibiotics it takes at least 48 h untill start working and  
see results. they also explained what to do  
when he  
feels like breathing is a bit difficult, checked his heart rate and the level of oxygen, all fine. really pleased with the way they were treated the case. forth day my son still not  
well , not being able to take even a short walk , totally exhausted, feeling nauseous and hard to  
breathe. at some point i took the decision to call again 111 thinking maybe the antibiotics prescribed are not working for him. after they went through with me  
and did another assessment they advised to go a&e with him. all good , we went, very nice staff at he triage, tried to calm him  
down and explained to him  
that actually he can breathe, oxigen levels were very good, but my son still feeling that he cannot breathe properly. in a while we have been seen by a doctor  
and from  
that moment things became so  
confusing fo me as a parent. He listened my sonâ€™s chest, it sounded fine for him,checked  
the x-ray my son had it 4 days before, he said all  
good, everything looked  
good for  
him, he said  
he cannot see a shadow and lungs are looking as they should for a child his age. So  
as he could not identify any physical problem  
he said we deal  
now with a child with anxiety attacks and to  
refer my child  
to childrenâ€™s mental health department. i  
wondered why , how  
and why my son would  
have these attacks? i asked as i was really confused why one doctor said 4 days ago that had the chest infection and he s got another opinion. he answered the child  
is fine and easily can say he has anxiety attacks. i asked why he had the antibiotics for and what should i do. he recommended to  
interrupt the treatment the next day and look at the other problem and he said â€œ i cant say what happened 4 days agoâ€. i left and next day we started again with the same problem. i  
have contacted our local  
gps and i  
asked for advice as i was totally confused. as these days there are not face to face appointments  
with the gps i  
had a phone call appointment with one of our gp. without asking to  
actually see my son for another examination and following my description of symptoms he could not make it clear for  
me, he said he does not have access to a&e files and he thought the same  
i should refer him  
to childrenâ€™s  
mental health. days went past and things are still not clear for  
me, did he have a chest infection or panic attacks?He feels better blessed him  
still accusing time to time shortness of breathing and pressure on his chest. Who  
to trust, first doctor, second one  
or the third one???????

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Carematters
title: Poor communication
body:
I strongly feel that as they did not know me I was pre judged. I had met one amazing receptionist who was excellent in her role. This receptionist will never realise the standard they set for their colleagues, their empathetic and caring nature was very clear when I rang and explained I was in a mental health crisis.  
Alongside this in the upcoming weeks while I was waiting for a follow up from the CMHT, this person offered support and explained who I could contact to escalate my concerns. Unfortunately, their colleagues did not demonstrate the same core values and if they had them, they have had ample opportunities to show them but failed.  
As new medication had been given and it started to settle I knew that I still needed medical help and that I wasn't ok yet, I had rang and asked for a call with the Dr or an appointment and was told to expect a phone call that phone call shortly after two- this never happened and when I rang again I was told that they had forgotten to put it on the list. I appreciate honesty and I had no issue with that as we are only human and are working in strange and unpredictable times.  
The Doctor did then give me a call and instead of confirming the truth told me that they wouldn't be making the phone call until 17: 20 anyway- I explained that the receptionist had already explained the truth to which then the doctor confessed. A week later I had booked for a smear and I was shocked when I was met with a sit down and I will take your blood pressure- no introduction no how are you? I asked for the name before the procedure started and told them I myself was a nurse there was no communication- while getting dressed a colleagues walked into the room and thankfully the curtain had been closed over.  
I could see on their computer that they were able to see my medical records and I truthfully felt like I was being judged for having the illness I do and if this was not the case where was her person centred care? I work in healthcare as I have said, I do believe that each patient has a voice and that is why I am giving this care opinion for learning opportunities. Communication is at the core of everything we do, it is core to the care provided. I never in my wildest dreams expected to have the health issues I currently have and to feel this way has made my nervous and anxious to ring and ask for help.  
I am very aware that mental health is hard and its hard to help patients who are suffering and see no way of improvement and I know that the Dr. on my case has done everything correctly so I thank them for that. Maine medical is a beautiful practice and I have not had the full opportunity of meeting everybody so I do hope that this is not seen as a negative for all reading this but instead only a reminder that honest, caring communication is key to good patient outcomes.

title: Careful, thorough and friendly
body: I arrived at 8.05 am and was seen by the Nurse within 15 minutes. He listened carefully to me and explained what was wrong (Conjunctivitis), the treatment and told me how long the treatment should take to work and things to look out for such as areas which become hot. His manner was excellent.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rapid result from PALS
body: My inpatient discharge summary contained a serious error. I contacted PALS to discuss this and on the same day received a telephone call from the doctor who compiled the report. He readily acknowledged the mistake, apologised, and undertook to rewrite the summary without the error. NHS staff are under pressure, and human errors are inevitable on occasion. It is good to know that PALS is there to assist so successfully in putting things right.

title: badly managed
body: badly managed to say the least phoning wellspring a nightmare. costly frustrating hardly get through .then if you do no appointments doc away  truly badly managed need to install system to call callers back automatically need cosing down everyone complains not so good doctors pass the buck say ring that number to get rid of you   dont care  truly shockingnmakes you ill

title: Impossible to make an appointment
body: Even when I am number one in the endless telephone queue I still have to wait 10 minutes plus to have my call answered and then I am told that it is not possible to make an appointment unless I call at 8.00am in the morning. I explain that I am working at 8.00am in the morning and can't call then. I am told to e-consult or call 111. E consult tells me to make an urgent appointment at the GP and so I call again to be told it's still not possible to make an appointment and when I get frustrated as I have been told my case is urgent - the receptionist hangs up. I have since had to have an urgent call with a clinician from 111 who has advised me I have dangerous synptoms and will need to be checked up asap. Unfortunately that seems not to be possible with my own GP.

title: Great local Hospital
body: I am just recovering from gallbladder removal surgery. I am extremely grateful for all the lovely staff that looked after me whilst I was nervous about my operation and being on my own. They were all so friendly. The hospital is amazing and  very clean, I would definitely recommend Circle Bath to anyone.

title: Shocking communication
body: I tried to register with this surgery on 16th February. Having completed the forms on their website I visited the surgery to hand them in. I was told I had filled the wrong forms and to email the surgery for the correct forms. 2 weeks later they responded to my email with the forms - why are these available on their website like other surgeries? I swiftly returned them but despite multiple attempts (6 emails and 10+ phone calls, none of which were answered after waiting over 30 minutes each time) I register with an alternative practice. I received communication from this surgery 9 weeks after my original contact. Very disappointing poor communication. As per other reviews, looks like itâ€™s for the best Iâ€™ve registered elsewhere.

title: Why no doctor?
body: Why are GPS refusing to see patients? While everywhere else is opening up - I can see a dentist, optician, even hairdresser or beautician - why are the GPs still refusing to see patients? This appears to me to be tantamount to negligence. Fortunately covid infection levels are decreasing and there is no excuse for GPs to hide behind locked doors any longer.

title: Exemplary Care!
body: I had an operation to remove a small tumour from my bladder - I was nervous about the procedure and the eventual outcome but I was treated with the utmost care and attention throughout and was amazed at the consideration given to me by all the staff  - from the surgeon, the anaesthetist and all the nurses. A big thank you to the whole team for the wonderful work that they do!

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: The practice have an excellent service. They have worked amazing hard through the pandemic to provide care to my family. Really supportive. Thank you.

author: birthstory94
title: My Birth Experience
body:
After having a traumatic experience with my first baby, I was very nervous about coming in to hospital to have my second. Last week on Monday 5th April I was admitted to be induced to Ward 31A at RAH Paisley. Induction failed, and it was decided I would go for a c section on 7th April. I was in my own room at this point and the every midwife that came in were always so lovely and caring.  
When going down for my c section, emotions took over and I was extremely nervous. The midwives in recovery were absolutely amazing with me, reassuring me and calming me down. I wish I caught their names because I canâ€™t thank them about for being there for me whilst my partner was on route. I would like to say a special thank you to Paul. He guided me through my c section and made the atmosphere so positive. If it wasnâ€™t for Paul, I would never have been so calm. Paul, you are so amazing at your job and I would like to thank you for helping to bring my baby girl in to this world. You brought humour and made me laugh at I time I never thought I would.  
The care in recovery afterwards was second to none. I was then moved back to Ward 31A. Again, the care I received was absolutely outstanding and every midwife was happy to help and never made you feel like you were annoying them by pressing your buzzer. Laura helped me for 2 days in a row, and she was amazing. There were a couple of other midwives who helped me and I didnâ€™t catch their names, all lovely nurturing people. I have now been home for 3 days and have been reflecting on my experience. I hope the midwives get to see my thanks, as they have no idea how much I appreciate their help. Although it is their job, they have a huge impact on peopleâ€™s lives and I will never forget my amazing experience.

title: Room For Improvement
body:
After waiting on the phone 45 minutes the recptionist answered and then proceeded to blast me with information - how to request a repeat  prescription via a complicated email address and then told me the phone number for the blood clinic (telephone number) to book my blood test. All of this very important information was said so quickly I had to ask her to repeat the info several times. I am english speaking, have no hearing imparements and have an able mind and was left wondering how if I was not english speaking/ able minded/ or old how I would have managed.
I understand that this V.important information is probably shared many many times a day, but I would think that 1) the email address be simpler 2)  the receptionists stop rolling this info out so quickly, most of us do not work in the NHS.........
Had to call back to clarify and was held in a queue for a further hour and 14 minutes

title: Frustrated Patient
body: I am very disappointed with this Surgery. I called them on Fri 9th April requesting to see a doctor and was told that no doctors were available today, at that time I was in considerable discomfort with my breathing as sessional hay fever had brought on my Asthma. It was suggested that I go to the walk in centre at Ashford Hospital. After waiting 3.5hrs at the centre I was seen by a nurse who asked if I was referred to them by my surgery, she was not surprised to hear that I had been and said that 90% of patients today were referrals from surgeries. Which begs the question, what patients are the surgeries accepting? After a short examination I was told to increase my dosage of medicine. On Monday 12th I was no better stoll unable to breath normally and decided to drive to my surgery and asked to see a doctor, as I was really struggling to breath and had been for almost a week. I was told to fill out a form online, I said that I needed to see a doctor today and was promised that once I submitted an online form I would be able to see a doctor. Two hours after submitting my form I received a message that a doctor would call me on Friday 16th sometime during surgery hours. I hardly visit the surgery and usually only when its Asthma related. This Spring my Asthma has been particularly bad leaving me not only struggling to breath but very anxious and not able to sleep well since 5th April. I am one unhappy Patient.

author: indigoqe64
title: Nurse-led Clinic
body: Made to feel completely at ease by nurse on the phone first, then when I arrived for my appointment. Discreet service. Follow up visit just as positive and both the nurse and doctor who saw me were very kind, helpful and reassuring.

author: Sara20
title: IUS Coil Fitting
body: As my first time visiting the clinic I was very nervous but as soon as I got in to reception I was made to feel at ease by all of the staff. After having my blood pressure checked by a lovely nurse I was sent into the consultation room with Dr Rocke and another nurse. They were both very chatty and friendly which made me feel very comfortable. She was very thorough with the consent form and made me aware of all the side effects I could experience and what the procedure entailed which put any of my concerns at ease. After leaving the room I was then greeted again by reception staff before I left. I would definitely be happy with telling my friends the amazing service that the clinic provided considering how nervous I was going and how amazing all the staff were there.

author: Spryng
title: Endoscopy
body: Excellent, professional, supportive treatment before, during and after my endoscopy at East Surrey hospital.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Broken Ribs
body: In late Feb my horse spooked and broke my ribs. The A&E staff, ward staff and scanning operators were top drawer. This is the NHS at its best. Thank you!

title: Excellent service
body: I just wanted to leave a message to say what a great service weâ€™ve had in difficult circumstances during C19 very thorough and supportive GP. I feel very lucky to be registered with this surgery.

title: Excellent efficient service.
body:
Most professional and courteous staff providing covid vaccination service.Good social distancing and queing arrangements. 
Thank you all.

title: Great Practice
body: The GP was a gentle presence among us. All routine Clinics in the Hospital are limited because of COVID19. Yet the surgery managed to do treatments to ease my discomfort with my hearing and his work was helpful and much appreciated. Thank you.

title: Covid vaccination
body: We have had our second vaccination at Lane End. Very organised and ran to time. The staff were very friendly as were the volunteers. We felt safe in the environment.

title: General practice & care
body: Fantastic care and reassurance shown when very frightened about a possible stroke, the care and support shown in difficult times by all staff was outstanding.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Vaccination
body: I had both my vaccinations at Whitley House although I am not a patient. The service was quick professional & I was taken care of regarding after the jab.

title: Breast screening service
body: I have had many breast screening appts in the last 18 years, all of which I approach with trepidation knowing that they will be uncomfortable, awkward, and that they will bring forth a wave of memories and emotions. My radiologist today was amazing. She began by asking how I was feeling about being there, something I have never previously been asked. She listened attentively while I waffled on about my past experiences with a warm smile. She then talked me through exactly what was going to happen, and told me what she was doing and why at each stage, encouraging me to tell her if it was too uncomfortable. Her warmth, understanding and encouragement made this screening appt so much more manageable than any I have ever had before, and there have been a few!! My appt was 11am on 15th April, hopefully she will know who she is! Thank you so much.

title: Absolutely SUPERB service! Second to none.
body: Moved from another practice several months ago and registered with Slaithwaite Health Centre - should have made the move far sooner. All, from front reception to doctors & support staff are working extremely hard, together, and delivering a first rate, all round service. Think the 'together' is a value not widely achieved, especially in current times. Thank you so very much!

title: Well organised innoculation centre
body:
Had my second Pfizer innoculation this morning. Time slot of 8.40 but got in a little earlier. Well controlled, orderly queue and had my innoculation done almost immediately. Was out in the recovery tent for my 15 mins wait at 8.34.  How is that for effecuency.

Well done the Beckenham Beacon and all the staff.  Thank You it is much appreciated.

title: Wonderful people and practice
body:
A really excellent GP service, the doctors are incredibly well informed and proactive. And really take the time to explain your care and medication with empathy. The staff at reception and on the phone are also brilliant and efficient. 
I do think the practice could do with modernising but not sure they have much of an option considering the building they are in.

title: Great service
body: Excellent service in and out in 15 minutes. Very efficient, Covid safe. All members of staff were very friendly

author: Oldman44
title: The standards of care
body:
My wife had a fall and attended Sunderland royal hospital. Our local hospital is south tyneside and we have always had excellent treatment there. Most recently my wife had a fall a few weeks ago and was in south tyneside for a few hours.  
What a difference in the standards of care we received between the 2 departments. My wife advised nothing is too much trouble for the staff at south tyneside, on her last visit she was given something to eat, regular hot drinks and staff were friendly, chatty and funny, including her in conversations and making her at ease with the situation. Waiting times were explained to her by the nurse in charge who was funny and extremely down to earth. My wife advised nothing was an issue for them and if she needed the toilet, her needs were attended to as quickly as possible.  
On attending Sunderland royal she was dumped in a room and left for several hours waiting to be seen. She said the nurses were dour, constantly complaining about how busy they were and abrupt. Bloods were taken by a nurse who didnâ€™t wear gloves or wash their hands.She asked for assistance to the toilet and was ignored. She asked for a glass of water and was ignored. She had her scan and then had a 5 minute discussion with a doctor who said she could go. Blood results were not discussed or explained. My wife said it was like the doctor wanted her out of there as quickly as possible. My wife left after 5 hours and wasnâ€™t given anything to eat or drink despite being diabetic. She asked for assistance to the toilet and was ignored. The journey home was awful for her as she was desperate for the toilet l. The indignity is appalling.  
We both wish instead of going to sunderland, which was the nearest hospital when she had her fall, that we had travelled to south tyneside. Both departments were busy at the time she attended. Yet the standard of care we received was vastly different.  
The staff at Sunderland hospital did not show enough empathy and compassion. Well done south tyneside. Sunderland - hang your heads in shame.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient Practice
body: I have been with this GP for the last 3 years and despite not requiring alot of GP appointments, the few times me and my partner have used them - we have had quick and efficient responses - the nurses particularly have been helpful.

title: Fantastic
body: I had oral surgery but the became concerned about a skin lesion in a different area! Thank you! You spotted skin cancer now being treated

readBy.name: Cambridgeshire And Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

title: Life Saving
body: On 27th September I saw the consultant who immediately referred me to L & D as he suspected I may have had a heart attack. Due to his knowledge and quick thinking I was admitted and had a stent fitted and the diagnosis was a heart attack.  I was a "walking time bomb" and due to his quick thinking (I was not having the normal symptoms no chest pains or any other signs associated with a heart attack) I am now on the way to making a full recovery. The practice is extremely lucky to have his knowledge and expertise. We all moan about waiting for appointments but when it matters this particular GP came through for me

title: Brilliant people and Great practice
body: The reception members, doctors, and nurses are always friendly and helpful. Every experience we had was perfect. Keep up the good work. Much appreciated

title: COVID vaccination
body:
Everything was well organised. All of the staff I met were polite, friendly efficient and followed safety rules.
Thank you to all staff and volunteers.

title: Great Practice
body: I think everyone knows that the practice is working at capacity.   My experience has been very positive.  Electronic consultation worked well - received call back and had the required consultations and prescriptions same day.  Well done to all - including the lady supervising the door!  Keep it up.

title: Great practice team, excellent care
body: I am fairly new to the practice and Iâ€™ve been really impressed with the quality of care Iâ€™ve received. Unfortunately I have been unwell with a few different issues lately,  and so Iâ€™ve had to be in frequent contact over the last couple of months. Every single person I have spoken to or seen has been helpful, validating, friendly and efficient. I feel well on the mend now, and feel confident in the treatment and plans made with the practice team. Itâ€™s really helped me keep a grip on my mental health during what could have been a very challenging time. Thanks very much!

title: excellent response
body: I made a request to assist a patient and it was responded to immediately, very impressed. I appreciate this is at difficult time with the other external constraints.

author: MM47
title: Exceptional ambulance response & ED care.
body:
My Mum had a severe angina attack, I called 999, from the calm call handler, talking us through taking aspirin, reassuring & reiterating help was on itâ€™s way to the professional caring & friendly paramedics Simon & Ryan. Detailing all their investigations, ensuring my Mumâ€™s comfort. Giving her options & taking her opinion into consideration. Their exceptional care made a stressful time so much easier-I send grateful thanks to them.  
Also our thanks go to the Emergency Department at FVRH, for their care & updates when we called. My mum said her continual observations, bloods& X-rays made her feel safe& looked after. Special thanks to Tracey who showed such kindness during her time there, bringing my Mum safely out to us. Also to the Student Nurse .  
She was also delighted her paramedics checked in on her , when they brought other patients in!  
From the start of the attack to returning home it was 6 hours.  
Our fabulous NHS-thank you! ðŸ’•

author: Charlstar7
title: Had to go to hospital due to chest pains.
body: Had chronic chest and back pain, that got so bad I couldn't sleep or lay down. I had to be taken to hospital by ambulance. Felt really nervous, and I hated that an ambulance had to come as I never like to pull on resources from the NHS as they're so busy. But overall paramedics made me feel cared for. Got to the West suffolk A& E and they were absolutely amazing,   attentive and so caring. I was so worried, but they checked me thoroughly to put my mind at rest. The nurse who took my bloods was the best ever, no pain very professional,   and a nurse called JosÃ¨ who helped, was great too.

author: Tai chi
title: Secondary cancer and scoliosis
body: Realise it has been and will be long term stuff to live well with.   Lovely to have help with the pain of uneven musculature and compromised lung use

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Garmg73
title: CBT Therapy
body: After suffering trauma after being assaulted by neighbours in January 2020 my husband was in a very low, depressed state. Believing he would never come through the darkness and live his life as before he was adamant that therapy wouldnâ€™t help him. However, after 14 sessions of CBT therapy he is a completely different person, back to his cheerful self and looking at things in a positive way.

author: Cuddledoon
title: Different hospital but equally outstanding care
body:
Earlier last week I shared my story on Care opinion, complimenting the staff at Queen Margaret Hospital in Dunfermline. You were gracious enough to publish my story.  
In an emergency situation, it became necessary for me to be re-admitted to hospital last week - this time to Victoria Hospital in Kirkcaldy. The ambulance drivers, Angela and Dave, were supportive, friendly and totally committed.  
All the staff whom I met over four days, were so professional and caring. Being a second invasive operation for me in three days, I was somewhat apprehensive, but the nursing staff (and I must have met a couple of dozen) were very reassuring and the theatre staff, the Anaesthetists, the Urology Consultant demonstrated the outstanding service being provided by NHS Fife.  
Naming individuals can be invidious especially when there are teams at work, but I trust that all those working with Siobhan, Kath, Ellie, Morgan and Mr al Jaafari will accept reflected glory.  
However, I have to make a special mention of Dr Ayers who performed my prostatectomy. From the moment that she took time to describe the procedure pre-op, to the time going into theatre, to her post-op attention on subsequent days, she exuded confidence and warmth, and made a lasting and indelible impression upon me. Not only does she have the intelligence and huge talent to become eminently successful (she is already well on her way) in her chosen profession, but she has, in spades, what many albeit able people, lack - namely communication skills and an open and friendly personality and demeanor which clearly endears her to patients. A real indicator is that the nursing staff all talked fondly of Dr Ayers. NHS Fife should be aware of the gem that it has in that young lady!  
Two Fife hospitals for me within a short period : even in these difficult times, both showed the resolve and professionalism of their staff. It is all too easy to moan and be negative, but the powers to be should appreciate and recognise just what they have, from not only highly talented doctors but also totally dedicated nursing staff, many of whom would describe themselves as just ordinary people. Far from ordinary, in my opinion!

author: waterbj56
title: Covid vaccine at SSE
body:
Absolutely amazed by the guys at the SSE from staff in the car park directing cars to park, guys at the front door ensuring people are wearing masks and sanatising hands.
Had a lovely girl who took my details and checked my ID. Not sure of her name but she was lovely!
Gary was the guy who checked that I was safe to get the vaccine and he was lovely and so relaxed which made me feel relaxed too.
The 2 young guys who gave me my vaccine I think one was called James. He was so lovely and excellent and giving the vaccine. I didnâ€™t feel a thing.
Got taken before my time and was checked in, screened and vaccinated all in less than 5 mins.
Excellent idea at the end with seats so people stay for 15mins post vaccine and nice to see chairs getting wiped down properly after people have left.
Overall, excellent experience, not to many people, good flow and lovely staff. Well done everyone at the SSE

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: scstpdwn
title: covid-19 vaccination
body:
Had my second vaccination today.  
Plenty of parking, and no queue outside.I was receiving the injection within 5 minutes of reporting in and was driving out of the car park 25 minutes after arrival.  
Both vaccinations were well organised - can't think of any way it could have been improved on, and certainly can't think of any aspect on which to complain.  
Well done to our Government for procuring the vaccines, and to the national and local NHS for rolling out its distribution - I'm proud of what has been achieved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Im a happy bunny
title: Getting vaccine
body: Appointment was at lakeside Craigavon arrived on time was told to sanitise my hands put fresh Mask on asked to stand in line moved very quickly in no time at all ID was checked vaccine given lovely staff very helpful nothing was a problem had to sit for 15minutes after vaccine then allowed to go home with my second appointment made. Second vaccine has now been given I would like to praise everyone from start to finish what a great team in Craigavon well done.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Megqg56
title: My endoscopy experience.
body: Had an Upper GI Endoscopy. I was feeling very anxious, but Sister Henderson and her team were amazing. Everything was well explained, and really put my mind at rest. Got my results and everything was okay. So very relieved.Thanks once again to the team.

author: Miss Marple Fan
title: All Services due to hospitalisation
body:
Our 87 year old mother was hospitalised on Easter Sunday morning and although she has been in and out of hospital/respite over the past number of years on a pretty regular basis, she had not had cause to attend hospital or her GP (other than for her vaccines) throughout the COVID pandemic. It was a shock for our family when she became poorly on Sunday and we had to call the ambulance service.  
As usual the paramedic attended first and was fantastic, the call handlers from the Ambulance Service were calm and excellent and the 2 Ambulance officers were also a credit to the NHS. We felt reassured and not overly alarmed that we would not be allowed to be with her as we knew she would be looked after. After not too many hours in A&E she was admitted to a stroke Ward in the Ulster Hospital. We were allowed a quick visit that night and then afterward only one visit, for one hour, once a week. Of course we understood but were worried about her not seeing us or fully understanding why and we too would be comforted by visiting her.  
I found out about Virtual visiting when i visited on Wednesday 7th April and we set up Virtual Visiting which was organised by two wonderful ladies in the team. It was done via Zoom and booking was so simple. I received an email with the zoom link and i shared with other members of our family. Lisa brought a tablet to Mum's ward, logged on and we all were able to see our Mum, laugh and chat to her and I know that both she and we were really happy to see each other.  
It is a wonderful service and whilst can never replace the face to face visiting, in circumstances such as this or for families who may live some distance away or cannot attend due to their own health issues, etc the Virtual Visiting is definitely something that think we would definitely wish to avail of and keep using.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: coordinationmf77
title: Pregnancy - My amazing midwife
body:
I have just been signed off from my midwife Jamie,  
From the day I met Jamie she was just amazing, she was super professional but soon turned to her being part of my family!  
I was always nervous about this pregnancy due to having to travel to  
Aberdeen hospital instead if my local Dr Greys, due to my baby being on the 97th line he was going to be a large baby on top of all the extra waters i had,  
Jamie reassured me threw the whole pregnancy, she always made me feel at ease every time I seen her and always talked me through everything.  
she was always smiling and honestly the best midwife I have ever had!

author: snowde39
title: Removal of cyst
body: Very relaxed while procedure was done, was made to feel at ease by Kirsty and Aileen clinical nurses

author: Gazzap60
title: My day Surgery
body: Surgery on my broken Ankle anesthetist was very informative and put me at easy,nurses were very friendly especially Amanda with the discharge information,great service by all.

title: Long waiting time
body: Appointment time was 2.30pm. Waited till after 5.30pm for the surgery.  Delay had built up during the morning.  Why couldnâ€™t afternoon patients be called to attend later.  It was after 7.00pm when I got home.  A very stressful afternoon.

title: Brilliant hospital
body: Having had both eyes done.I can't praise sparmedica bolton.enough.all the team throughout.are brilliant.and really caring.and friendly .and is painlessly clean thanks to the hygiene staff.from my 1st.refferal.to my discharge.I was very well looked after. .the surgery is a painless procedure.and approx 20 mins.even though I was anxious.they put me at ease.even holding my hand.so considerate and caring people.I now have great eyesight.the difference is amazing.I can actually read a newspaper.or book.and thread a needle.so thank you paramedics Bolton.you do a truly amazing thing.

title: Great Reception Team
body: When phoning to arrange for appointments for my first and then second Covid vaccinations, the ladies I spoke to on both occasions were not only most professional, but also so very helpful and friendly. Thank you for the great "Customer Service"!

title: Another terrible experience
body: Once again, I am shocked at the terrible experience I have had with this surgery. Their poor admin and the resulting unacceptable attitude from a GP has left me feeling awful.

title: Excellent Vaccination Centre and GP Surgery
body:
Super efficient, friendly and professional very happy with the
whole experience from the volunteers to the medical staff and I
didn't feel a thing !

title: Caring practice
body: Seen promptly today and welcomed with warmth and compassion. Thorough investigation to the problem-seen by the paramedic. Thank you

title: Endoscopy excellence
body:
I visited the Endoscopy department today and was extremely impressed by their care and professionalism, particularly during these difficult times which necessitates so much extra work for them.
Everyone who dealt with me was exceptionally courteous, kind and patient and during the procedure every care was taken to minimise discomfort. 
I would reassure anyone who has an Endoscopy appointment at any time in the future that they will receive the most excellent care from the staff.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Current situation
body:
We can only praise Park Surgery for their vaccination programme.
My partner and I have both now received both doses.
We have been very impressed with how organised they have been,especially in these extremely difficult times.
A pat on the back for all involved.
Thank you for your hard work,it's appreciated

title: Disgusting treatment
body: Called to let my disabled daughter use the toilet (radar keyholder) was refused entry to use the toilet. Total lack of understanding and made us wait. My daughter ended up having to go in a Bush at side of building. Lack of dignity and privacy caused. We both had masks on so we're not breaching covid policy. Can't believe someone would have so little compassion. My daughter has continence problems hence being a radar member. So disgusted at the receptionists attitude that I walked off. Uncaring at its worse.

title: calm and friendly atmosphere
body: It was my second Covid jab. Although somehow my name had not been listed, there was no stress. The staff found a way to slot me into the system without any fuss. Full marks! This is not my normal surgery, so I could not give informed answers to most of the multiple choice questions.

title: Not good
body: They often do not help They are evasive, I asked about an issue at my eye and I already had seen an optician but he said bring a report from your optician. So I do not recommend them

title: Excellent
body: Excellent service very helpful and pleasant. On time and very caring and efficient. A very pleasing experience.

title: Frustrating
body: On several occasions when I have called I have found the receptionist to be very abrupt. She has not listened fully to my comments and spoke over me before I finished. This resulted in an incorrect booking being made.

title: Very efficient practice.
body: The nurse was cooperative and very efficient and made the visit most comfortable and friendly to both my wife and myself.

title: Incredible Professional Service
body: Thank you so much for looking after me at the Emergency Department at Furness Hospital on Sunday 11th April 2021.  I had a cycling accident and needed checks to see what the issues were.  The service was incredible and the staff are amazing.  Always positive and kind.  I will be forever grateful. Thank you

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Caring Doctors
body: Reading above reviews, I felt it necessary to write this review. Yes it is difficult to get through on the phone lines, you may need to wait up to an hour but my advice would be put your phone on loudspeaker, grab a cup of tea and relax or (put a load of washing on) and keep at it. The receptionists are ok( some more polite than others; maybe apologise for the long wait first before asking what the patientâ€™s problem is and a caring tone to an ill person makes them feel better especially after the tension of waiting for the phone to be answered). The doctors are friendly, apologetic and caring. They listen carefully and give importance to whatâ€™s been said as well as getting the right treatment, resolving issues in referrals and ensuring we go back if the problem escalates. They are respectful and patient even if patient is old or suffering from mental health issues. This is a difficult time, hopefully the waiting times on the phone get shorter, but donâ€™t let it put you off from seeking treatment. Other surgeries also have similar phoning in times and waits, but doctors/ midwives who are not as caring. Kind regards.

title: X Ray Department
body: The Radiographer, Nurse and Admin staff are to be commended for their care.  Would recommend them all for their kindness in dealing with a very anxious patient

title: Still excellent hospital
body: Having worked there for a few years as a Porter/Driver and realised how caring everyone was. Went back for a reverse shoulder operation and experienced the receiving end of this great hospital. Had no complaints from admission to discharge. It was a pleasure and I felt well cared for. It's still a fantastic team all working together for the patient.

title: Poor management
body:
Canâ€™t fault the doctors at this practice and are very good to contact you back with a telephone appointment. The poor management skills of this practice however is undesirable in relation to one or more of the reception team and aware we are going through a rough period because of the pandemic and have every sympathy how busy it is, but one of the particular receptionists is often rude, does not listen to your requests and will talk over you when trying to discuss the issue. 

Customer or patient service is key in any organisation and can be off putting to anyone either wishing to contact by telephone or in person. 

Would

title: In great hands.
body:
I cannot praise this department enough; during the COVID-19 pandemic and personal worries regarding diagnoses and tests , from the surgeons down to the cleaners, every effort was made to put patients at ease and accelerate the treatment in a professional manner.
This would certainly be my hospital department of choice if I should ever need future medical care... you are in very good hands!

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very bad service
body:
Difficult to get appointment for ailments even major
Difficult to speak to reception
If trying to call them the calls are in a queue of about 50 minutes or more.

title: maps
body:
the website is a mess.
there is no direction information and the dept. list was last updated 2015.
there is no map for directions within the hospital.
there is no indication of parking facilities

title: Very helpful
body: I had an occasion to require some eye drops urgently and knew that I would have to wait at least 48 hours, having explained to receptionist that I really needed them the next day if possible she said she would do her best and that she did within 3 hours the pharmacy contacted me to say they a prescription waiting for me for the drops, I cannot thank the surgery enough for such kindness and speed , big thanks  Elizabeth Noll

title: unhelpful
body: Completely unhelpful. I live next door and am having to travel a 4 hour round trip to get a vaccine as they simply would not help. Unbelievable and rude

title: excellent experience
body: Myself and my husband had our 2nd Covid Jab. The setup is so efficient both at the surgery and the car park opposite. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The staff were excellant and put us at ease while we waited. I did not feel the injection at all. Well done.

title: Lovely staff at A&E
body: I visited A&E for an ECG and some blood tests recently to detect a possible blood clot and was blown away at how kind and attentive all the staff was. Yes the wait is long but all the staff showed so much humanity and understanding, especially in those highly stressful times due to Covid. I was really impressed and can't thank them enough for all the amazing work they do.
